headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Cross-Examination of Jennifer Crumbley, Michigan School Shooter's Mother, by Prosecutors; Ethan Crumbley Received 9mm Pistol as a Present, According to Jennifer Crumbley. Aired 10:30-11a ET

utterances.speaker: MARC KEAST, OAKLAND COUNTY ASSISTANT PROSECUTOR
utterances.sentences: In October, in September, in at least August, July, June, May, all 2021.

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER CRUMBLEY, DEFENDANT
utterances.sentences: Oh, 2021, correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: 2021. Thank you. Now, he left on Halloween, and you knew that your son was planning to hang out with him on Halloween.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. But his friend didn't show.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: We had texted -- I had texted his friend's mom the day before trying to confirm if he was still coming over, and that's when we found out that he was driven to Wisconsin and taken to that school.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. So, you're telling us you found out the day before Halloween.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. But that didn't stop you and James from going to the Halloween party at the barn.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't believe it was on Halloween.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's what Kira (ph) testified to.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: It was a Friday before Halloween.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: If there was a picture with a date stamp on it, would you deny it?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And it didn't stop you from after you left that party, without your son, you went to another Halloween party.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: We did.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And your son was home alone at that point?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: So, you talked to us a little bit about your son's hobbies in 2021. But in November 2021 -- so, we'll start with November the 1st, 2021. You know that those hobbies were non-existent. And I'll go one by one.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: So, you told us about bowling.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Bowling wasn't -- the team wasn't in session that point in time, wasn't it?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I think actually at that time he decided he didn't want to do bowling that year.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. So, he stopped bowling this sophomore year.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: He did. He did.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And it wouldn't have been bowling season anyway?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I guess not, no.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: So, one hobby you talked about yesterday, that was an exist -- that was not in existence in November of 2021?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct, but we did still go to the bowling alley with him.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And you said that he worked, but would you be surprised to learn that he only worked a few shifts post-COVID?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not surprised at all.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. So, he wasn't at work every day?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, he worked Tuesdays and Thursdays and sometimes Saturday mornings.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. But not very often?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, not very often.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: A handful of shifts post-COVID which, of course, March 2020 is when things shut down.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: He was working on a weekly basis.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And you knew that he didn't have any friends?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: That's not the right way to put it. I knew he had friends, but no, he did not have many friends.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You had never met another peer his age who he refers to as a friend.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: He actually had friends that used to come over prior to 2021 that he was still in contact with.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: We went through defense exhibits yesterday from 2019 to 2020. I'm talking about a 2021, at least from the time period where he sent you a message that he saw demons in the house.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Right. In 2021, the only friend that came to our house was the one that's on --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: -- that was on the thing.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: So, you knew to be true in November of 2021 that he had no peer support.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't know what he had in school. He told me he had friends in school that he talks to.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. You ever -- you never met them though?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And he didn't have any clubs at school he was a part of?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, not that year.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: So, you told us yesterday that your son wanted to design video games.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. He wasn't in a robotics club or a coding club at the high school?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: He did take a coding class prior 2021 and he was in the robotics after school activity in middle school.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Talking about in 2020 --

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm just telling you, he's been in that before. KEAST

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: No. OK. That's despite what happened in the spring of 2021, right?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: What happened in the spring of 2021 did not concern me.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, the one thing that seemed consistent with your son, to you at least, is his desire to obtain a weapon, is that right?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I wouldn't say that. No.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: He had a consistent desire to obtain a weapon.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Not to me, he did not.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. You didn't know about the 9mm?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, I knew about it.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. You didn't know about the 22's?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I knew about them.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And in fact, you posted on Instagram that he got himself a 22 --

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: -- in June of 2021.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And from that time up until the November 26, '21 purchase, he was wanting to get a 9mm.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I know him and my husband had discussed getting a 9mm. I'm not part of those conversations.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: But you knew them.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I knew but not -- that it was -- he was so, however you described it. He --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: I said, he consistently had a desire to obtain a weapon.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I know that -- I know they consistently talked about it, correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. They just talked about this is a gun. He talked about how he wanted the gun. You don't deny that?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: In November 26, you said you weren't there for the gun purchase?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I was not.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. But are you telling us you didn't know it was going to happen?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I did not know they were going to the gun store that day, no.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. But you knew that you were going to, eventually, get him a 9mm?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I did not know that.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. So, you're telling us that it was a surprise purchase to you?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: It was a surprise to me that they went to the gun store that day.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: It was not surprising to me that they purchased a gun that day.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And it didn't upset you that they bought a gun?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Not -- no, it did not.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: It upset you that they cut into your Christmas tree shopping time, but it didn't upset you that they bought a gun?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And you told us that it was, in your words, James' responsibility to take care of that gun?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, you don't deny that, at least according to the cell phone evidence, the photographic and video evidence, that you're the last adult to have possession of that gun.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. You were with him at the range on November the 27th.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You saw your son shoot the weapon.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You saw him shoot the last practice round before the shooting on November 30th?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: At the range?

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You saw how he stood?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Honestly, that didn't mean anything to me at that time until this whole case came about and I've learned what a shooter's stance is, so.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: He knew how to use the gun?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, he did.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: He's used one before.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: In fact, he showed you how to use the gun.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And the stance he took, you saw from the Oxford High School video, was the same. You saw that, right?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I don't know. I can't compare it. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. But you entrusted this responsibility -- would you agree with me that owning a firearm involves a great deal of responsibility and trust?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And you entrusted this responsibility to your husband, James?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: If you look at Exhibit 423, that's the Facebook chat thread between you and your husband. It's pretty clear you didn't trust James with much. Would you agree or disagree?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: It depends on what you're talking about.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, you didn't trust him to get out of bed on time.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You didn't trust him to cut the grass when it was time to cut the grass?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: He would cut the grass when it got to a length I didn't like. I didn't trust him.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You didn't trust him to update you on his whereabouts.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: There's a reason behind that.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You didn't trust him to not turn off or turn on the ring camera in your home?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You didn't trust him to keep track of your son?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, I trusted him to keep track of my son.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: In those messages that we'll see in Exhibit 423, asking him where is your son over and over and over again, does that signify trust or distrust to you?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: That was when my son was walking home from school. Not that I did not trust my husband with my son.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And you didn't really trust your husband to hold down a job.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: It's not that I didn't trust him to hold down a job. He had a hard time holding down one after COVID.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And in those messages, you are constantly asking him about work, how much money he's making, and what he's doing to obtain employment.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: I can pull the data, Counselor --KATE BOLDUAN, CNN NEWS CENTRAL CO-ANCHOR:  We're going to take you back to Michigan, where Jennifer Crumbley is on the stand. She is being cross-examined, and right now being pressed about her family dynamics, specifically at this moment, how many times or not she and her son expressed I love you to each other. This is the mother charged with gross negligence over the horrific crimes her son committed. Let's get back into this testimony. KEAST:  You told us that --

utterances.speaker: JUDGE CHERYL MATTHEWS, OAKLAND COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT
utterances.sentences: He asked if the test one was a year earlier and the other two were close in time of the shooting.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: The day of the shooting.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know --SHANNON SMITH, JENNIFER CRUMBLEY'S ATTORNEY: I'm asking --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Those have been admitted to evidence --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: -- do we know --

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: Wait. What's the question?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: OK. But he's asking about the text overall which have not been admitted into evidence. And I don't know that the text chain has all the texts. There is no foundation that what Mr. Keast is looking for --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Ms. Judge, in the cross-examination --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: -- is all the texts --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: -- if the --

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: He's asked of it --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: -- is that long. Would you argue with that? That's what he's saying -- he's asking. I mean, there are people --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I know, she's just -- she just doesn't know what --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Hold on, Counsel can't testify.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: It's OK. Well, I -- you know, there are people that end every conversation with love you. OK.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, I heard that.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: OK. So, and there are people who don't, right? So, he is asking what's normal for them and would she be surprised about how many times that appeared?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm just asking -- I get that. And I get that it's not common. I'm just asking what period --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: So, if this is an argument --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I'm just asking --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: -- Counsel can argue whatever she wants to.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: -- what period of text --

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: -- this is from.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, you have to redirect, right?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, she doesn't know what he's even basing these questions on at this point?

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: How -- OK. Well, it is inappropriate for Counsel to suggest --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: OK. She said, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: -- that she does or does not know.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: She can say, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: But she can also say, I don't understand the question.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: She can say that, too. If you don't -- Mr. Crumbley, if you don't understand the question, ask Mr. Keast to clarify it.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: All right?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: All right. Thank you, Judge.Now, yesterday, Mrs. Crumbley, you talked about going into planning mode.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And that was in reference to counsel only asking you about emotions and how you express emotions.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: All right. So, I want to talk to you about your planning mode and your priorities from the time that you were arrested.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Now, your phone calls were recorded from the time that you were arrested until now.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Do you know that? You know that.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I knew that.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You know that. OK. And your priority on your first phone call, December the 4th of 2021, was on your animals and the cash recovered from the art studio. Do you deny that?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't deny it.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. Do you deny that it wasn't until 10 days later and 14 calls later that you even mentioned your son?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I was --

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Do you deny it or not?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't, but I was under the impression that I couldn't mention him because I could get flagged at the jail.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Well, you mentioned him in later conversations.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And in fact, in one, a year later, March 25th of 2023, you said he just needs to man up. Do you recall that?

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. Do you not deny that you said it?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: It sounds like something I would say.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: In December of 2021, your concern was about a GoFundMe. Do you remember that?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I do not.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: I'm going to play this for you. Ms. Williams, can you have the volume up, please?

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: This is submitted into exhibit?

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: This is an impeachment, Judge.

utterances.speaker: MATTHEWS
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, you (INAUDIBLE).(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, there's no -- you know, Jennifer, that's -- you know --

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I said (INAUDIBLE), kind of a speaker face (ph), but I have people that call a lawyer welfare of my horses. So, I mean -- I'm just, I'm sorry. I shit (ph) against the wall to see what sticks.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What's that?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I just brought shit (ph) against the wall to see what sticks.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I know. I know. I know.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. That was between you and your dad?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And you asked him to set up a GoFundMe to pay for the board (ph) of your horses?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I did, yes.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. You were concerned about other things related to yourself around that time, weren't you?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Is this still planning mode?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: I believe so.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And you were arrested December the 4th. This is going to be December the 22nd.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: OK.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, oh. I have a project for Matt.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. OK.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Can you have her Google how many calories are in a bologna sandwich with white bread?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: How many calories in a bologna sandwich with white bread?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, American cheese.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: American cheese? OK. With American cheese?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you have any mayonnaise on it? CRUMBLEY

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, there's only mustard. And then peanut butter and jelly on white bread.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And peanut butter and jelly on white butter, OK. So, you're looking up bologna right now. That knows your lunch and dinner is?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: For an all-star, yes. And then for other stuff I -- my cereal is not something that I actually eat.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: With American cheese you have there?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. And an apple and a banana because I know you don't work --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No. No error (ph).

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: They're carb loading to me and I want to make sure I stay at least a thousand to a hundred calories.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: But I don't know if they have a hundred -- I know they have a hundred calories.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Is it OK I was on apple --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, the sandwich is 140 calories -- no, 240.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: OK. That's pretty much (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: 50 calories but that's --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, and peanut butter and jelly on white bread?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Still planning mode?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, I wasn't planning there, no.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. Now, we're talking about how you describe planning mode. You describe that in context to statements you made to the police on November the 30th, 2021, right? That's the context -- you used the words, planning mode, in relation to it?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: correct. KEAST(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. It's not an issue you're having. It's the issue of, you know, that bank -- he's going to be all this -- he's got issues with your (ph) mind stuff and have issues with -- you know, all kinds of stuff. (INAUDIBLE) bank you see posted on, it's like -- you know, it's over.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: But I still don't have that child deposit thing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The what?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Am I still going to need to deposit $300 for that child thing the government does?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes -- I don't know. I have a -- I just got -- I just got -- today, I lost access. For some reason, I'm not supposed to have that.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, I can't access it.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: That's what I'm looking --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I can access, basically, to view only. And it was hard to see every time there. But then also I lost access. And then, it took me -- I lost access like a couple days before Christmas.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. Is that still planning mode?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: We were talking about filing my taxes, if you played the whole thing.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You were asking about your child tax credit --

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: -- if you're still going to get that $300.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: My dad was doing my income taxes for me.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: Now, when we started, we confirmed that you understood the oath that you just took.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And that same oath you took yesterday.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And, you don't deny that you had $6,000 in cash in your purse the night you were arrested?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You don't deny that your purse with the cash and four cell phones were in a plastic tote?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You don't deny that that plastic tote was contained in a different plastic tote?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You don't deny that your backpack with clothing items was found in a different plastic tote in a different area of that studio?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And you don't deny that you knew you had been charged with involuntary manslaughter.

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: In fact, as early as December the 1st, 2021, at 6

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: That was what I was being told by a family that was texting me. That's what the charges might be announced as, correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. And one is to Mr. Monash (ph). There is a text to your cousin about you are being charged with an involuntary manslaughter. You don't deny receiving that?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: That's Wednesday, December the 1st, right?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And you sent your neighbor a message on Wednesday the 1st of 2021, 6

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: OK. December the 2nd, 2021, you wrote, they're saying involuntary manslaughter? CRUMBLEY

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: You don't deny that?

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: And, of course, you looked at different news articles about that the next day --

utterances.speaker: CRUMBLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KEAST
utterances.sentences: -- and later on that day? And then, you tested --
